questions.text: A delta-connected network can be transformed into an equivalent star-connected network. This transformation is based on:

choices.text: The principle of superposition
Thevenin's theorem
Network equivalence principles
Maximum power transfer theorem

questions.text: For a sinusoidal AC waveform, the form factor is the ratio of:

choices.text: Peak value to RMS value
RMS value to average value
Average value to RMS value
Peak value to average value

questions.text: The depletion region in a PN junction diode consists of:

choices.text: Free electrons and holes
Only free electrons
Only holes
Immobile positive and negative ions

questions.text: A MOSFET is a voltage-controlled device, meaning its output current is controlled by:

choices.text: The current at the gate terminal
The voltage at the gate terminal
The current at the drain terminal
The voltage at the source terminal

questions.text: Which type of oscillator is known for its high frequency stability?

choices.text: RC phase-shift oscillator
LC tank circuit oscillator
Crystal oscillator
Wien bridge oscillator

questions.text: The Q-point (quiescent point) in an amplifier's characteristic curve represents the:

choices.text: Maximum possible output voltage
Minimum possible output voltage
DC operating point with no input signal
Point of maximum efficiency

questions.text: Which of the following is a non-weighted binary code?

choices.text: BCD (Binary Coded Decimal)
Binary
Gray Code
Octal

questions.text: A full subtractor is a combinational circuit that computes the difference between:

choices.text: Two bits
Two bits and a borrow-in
Three bits
Two 4-bit numbers

questions.text: A register that can move its stored bits to the left or right is called a:

choices.text: Storage register
Buffer register
Shift register
Counter

questions.text: In microprocessors, an addressing mode specifies:

choices.text: The number of bits in an instruction
The type of instruction (arithmetic, logical, etc.)
How the effective address of an operand is calculated
The location of the next instruction

questions.text: The 8255 Programmable Peripheral Interface (PPI) has how many I/O ports?

choices.text: One 8-bit port
Two 8-bit ports
Three 8-bit ports
Four 8-bit ports

questions.text: A vectored interrupt is one where:

choices.text: The CPU polls each device to find the source of the interrupt.
The interrupting device provides the address of the interrupt service routine.
The interrupt cannot be disabled.
The interrupt is generated by a software instruction.

questions.text: In C, what is the purpose of the static keyword when applied to a local variable within a function?

choices.text: It makes the variable visible outside the function.
It causes the variable's value to persist between function calls.
It allocates the variable on the heap instead of the stack.
It makes the variable a read-only constant.

questions.text: Which of the following file modes in C opens a text file for both reading and writing?
In C++, a friend function of a class is a function that:

choices.text: Is a member of the class.
Can access the private and protected members of the class, even though it is not a member.
Can only access the public members of the class.
Is automatically inherited by derived classes.

questions.text: What is a virtual destructor in C++ used for?

choices.text: To prevent a class from being instantiated.
To ensure that the correct destructor is called for an object created through a base class pointer.
To create a destructor that cannot be called.
To declare a destructor in an abstract class.

questions.text: A hardwired control unit is characterized by:

choices.text: Its instruction set being stored in a control memory.
Its logic being implemented using gates, flip-flops, and decoders.
Its flexibility to add new instructions easily.
Its slower speed compared to a microprogrammed unit.

questions.text: The memory hierarchy in a computer system is arranged with:

choices.text: The fastest, smallest memory at the top and the slowest, largest memory at the bottom.
The slowest, largest memory at the top and the fastest, smallest memory at the bottom.
All memory types at the same level.
Only volatile memory.

questions.text: In an embedded system, a watchdog timer is used to:

choices.text: Keep track of the real time of day.
Generate periodic interrupts for multitasking.
Reset the system if it hangs or enters an undesirable state.
Control the speed of the processor.

questions.text: Rate-Monotonic Scheduling (RMS) is a scheduling algorithm for real-time systems that assigns priority based on:

choices.text: The execution time of the task.
The deadline of the task.
The frequency (or period) of the task.
The arrival time of the task.

questions.text: The Session Layer of the OSI model is responsible for:

choices.text: End-to-end reliable data transfer.
Routing packets across the network.
Managing dialogues (sessions) between computers.
Formatting and encrypting data.

questions.text: An IPv6 address is how many bits long?

choices.text: 32 bits
48 bits
64 bits
128 bits

questions.text: A link-state routing protocol, like OSPF, requires each router to:

choices.text: Periodically share its entire routing table with its neighbors.
Have a complete map of the network topology.
Only know the distance and direction to its immediate neighbors.
Send routing updates only when a change in topology occurs.

questions.text: A digital signature is used to ensure:

choices.text: Confidentiality
Availability
Authentication and non-repudiation
Integrity only

questions.text: The primary purpose of a Turing Machine in the theory of computation is to:

choices.text: Model the capabilities of all possible computers.
Define context-free languages.
Provide a basis for regular expressions.
Implement practical computing devices.

questions.text: An ambiguous grammar is one that:

choices.text: Has no production rules.
Can generate a string that has more than one valid parse tree.
Cannot generate any strings.
Contains only terminal symbols.

questions.text: A 3D shear transformation:

choices.text: Rotates an object about an axis.
Changes the size of an object.
Tilts or slants the shape of an object.
Moves an object to a new location.

questions.text: The RGB color model is an example of:

choices.text: A subtractive color model.
An additive color model.
A color model used only for printing.
A grayscale color model.

questions.text: Breadth-First Search (BFS) is an algorithm for traversing a graph that explores:

choices.text: As far as possible along each branch before backtracking.
All the neighbor nodes at the present depth prior to moving on to the nodes at the next depth level.
Only nodes that are part of a cycle.
The path with the lowest cost first.

questions.text: A sorting algorithm is considered 'stable' if:

choices.text: It has a worst-case time complexity of O(n log n).
It does not change the relative order of elements with equal keys.
It sorts the data in-place without requiring extra memory.
It is the fastest algorithm for all types of data.

questions.text: The Second Normal Form (2NF) in database normalization requires that:

choices.text: The database has no repeating groups or columns.
The database is in 1NF and all non-key attributes are fully functionally dependent on the primary key.
The database is in 2NF and has no transitive dependencies.
The database is in 3NF and every determinant is a candidate key.

questions.text: In an operating system, a process is in the 'Ready' state when it is:

choices.text: Currently being executed by the CPU.
Waiting for an I/O operation to complete.
Waiting to be assigned to the CPU for execution.
Terminated and waiting to be removed from memory.

questions.text: The Spiral Model of software development is a:

choices.text: Simple, linear model.
Model that focuses on rapid prototyping.
Risk-driven model that combines elements of both prototyping and the waterfall model.
Model that emphasizes iterative development without planning.

questions.text: In software engineering, 'cohesion' refers to:

choices.text: The degree to which the elements of a module are functionally related.
The degree of dependency between different modules.
The complexity of a module's code.
The number of bugs in a module.

questions.text: Which UML diagram is used to model the physical deployment of artifacts on nodes?

choices.text: Class Diagram
Sequence Diagram
Deployment Diagram
Use Case Diagram

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT one of the five SOLID principles of object-oriented design?

choices.text: Single Responsibility Principle
Open/Closed Principle
Liskov Substitution Principle
Data Hiding Principle

questions.text: In AI, knowledge representation using 'Frames' involves:

choices.text: Using formal logic to represent facts.
A network of nodes and links representing concepts and relationships.
Data structures that represent stereotyped situations with slots for specific details.
A set of if-then rules.

questions.text: The Hill Climbing search algorithm is a local search algorithm that:

choices.text: Always finds the global optimum.
Never gets stuck in local optima.
Continuously moves in the direction of increasing value to find the peak of the search space.
Explores the entire search space randomly.

questions.text: Reinforcement learning is a type of machine learning where:

choices.text: The model is trained on a labeled dataset.
The model learns to find patterns in an unlabeled dataset.
An agent learns to make decisions by performing actions and receiving rewards or penalties.
The model is given a set of rules to follow.

questions.text: The 'hidden layer' in a neural network is the layer of neurons:

choices.text: That provides the final output of the network.
That receives the initial input data.
That is between the input layer and the output layer.
That is not used during the training process.

questions.text: In engineering drawings, what does a 'scale' of 1:50 mean?

choices.text: 1 unit on the drawing represents 50 units in reality.
50 units on the drawing represent 1 unit in reality.
The drawing is 50 times larger than the actual object.
The drawing is 1/50th of the original paper size.

questions.text: The Minimum Acceptable Rate of Return (MARR) is:

choices.text: The interest rate at which NPV is zero.
The minimum rate of return that a company is willing to accept for a project.
The actual rate of return generated by a project.
The rate used to calculate depreciation.

questions.text: A Gantt chart is a project management tool used for:

choices.text: Identifying project risks.
Illustrating a project schedule, including task start and end dates.
Calculating the project budget.
Defining the project scope.

questions.text: Which of the following is a fundamental canon of engineering ethics?

choices.text: Act for each employer or client as faithful agents or trustees.
Prioritize project completion speed over all other factors.
Always use the lowest-cost materials.
Keep all project details confidential from the public.

questions.text: What is the primary legal document that governs the engineering profession in Nepal?

choices.text: The Nepal Labor Act
The Nepal Company Act
The Nepal Engineering Council Act
The Constitution of Nepal

questions.text: A universal gate is a logic gate that:

choices.text: Can be used to implement any other logic gate.
Has more than two inputs.
Is used in all digital devices.
Can operate with any voltage level.

questions.text: Virtual memory is a memory management technique where:

choices.text: A portion of the hard disk is used as an extension of RAM.
The memory is physically located on a different computer.
The entire program must be loaded into memory before execution.
Memory is allocated in a single contiguous block.

questions.text: In SQL, a JOIN clause is used to:

choices.text: Combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column between them.
Create a new table.
Delete rows from a table.
Update existing records.

questions.text: Which scheduling algorithm can lead to starvation for low-priority processes?

choices.text: First-Come, First-Served (FCFS)
Round Robin
Priority Scheduling
Shortest Job First (SJF)

questions.text: What does CSMA/CD stand for?

choices.text: Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Detection
Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Avoidance
Carrier Sense Media Access with Collision Detection
Code Sense Multiple Access with Collision Domain

questions.text: A context-free grammar is more powerful than a regular grammar because it can:

choices.text: Recognize any language.
Describe nested structures, like balanced parentheses.
Be implemented with a finite automaton.
Handle ambiguity.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of an index in a database?

choices.text: To enforce data integrity.
To speed up the retrieval of rows from a table.
To store large binary objects.
To create a backup of the table.

questions.text: Software maintenance that involves modifying the software to adapt to changes in the environment (e.g., a new operating system) is called:

choices.text: Corrective maintenance
Adaptive maintenance
Perfective maintenance
Preventive maintenance

questions.text: What is a 'heuristic' in the context of AI search algorithms?

choices.text: A guarantee of finding the optimal solution.
A rule of thumb or a strategy that provides a shortcut to a solution.
The final solution to a problem.
A method for exploring every possible path.

questions.text: The break-even point is the point at which:

choices.text: Total revenue equals total cost.
The project is completed.
The NPV is positive.
The IRR is equal to the MARR.

questions.text: What is the main advantage of using a cache memory?

choices.text: To increase the total storage capacity of the computer.
To provide permanent storage.
To reduce the average time to access data from the main memory.
To execute instructions.

questions.text: The process of converting an analog signal to a digital signal involves:

choices.text: Modulation and demodulation
Sampling and quantization
Encryption and decryption
Compression and decompression

questions.text: In C++, if you do not define a constructor for a class, the compiler will:

choices.text: Generate a compile-time error.
Provide a default constructor with no arguments.
Prevent you from creating objects of that class.
Automatically create a parameterized constructor.

questions.text: Which of the following is a key characteristic of cloud computing?

choices.text: It requires all data to be stored on a local server.
It provides on-demand access to a shared pool of computing resources over the internet.
It is less scalable than traditional on-premise infrastructure.
It is primarily used for running legacy applications.

questions.text: A 'protocol' in computer networking is a:

choices.text: Hardware device for connecting networks.
Set of rules that governs data communication.
Type of network cable.
Software application for browsing the internet.

questions.text: A circuit has a 50 Hz AC source connected to a 100 µF capacitor. What is the capacitive reactance (Xc)? (Use π ≈ 3.14)
Using Boolean algebra, simplify the expression: F = (A + B)(A + B').

choices.text: A
B
A + B
NEPAL
OFQBM
MDQZK
Compilation Error

questions.text: A system uses memory-mapped I/O. What does this imply?

choices.text: I/O devices are accessed using special instructions like IN and OUT.
I/O devices and memory share the same address space.
I/O operations are completely isolated from memory operations.
The system does not have a cache memory.

questions.text: You are given the IP address 172.16.10.50 with a subnet mask of 255.255.255.240. What is the broadcast address of this subnet?
A line segment has endpoints at (2, 4) and (8, 10). What are the coordinates of its midpoint?
Consider an initially empty AVL tree. What does the tree look like after inserting the keys 10, 20, and 30 in that order?

choices.text: A skewed tree with 30 as the root.
A balanced tree with 20 as the root.
A balanced tree with 10 as the root.
A balanced tree with 30 as the root.

questions.text:
What is the average turnaround time for the following processes using the Shortest Job First (SJF) non-preemptive scheduling algorithm? All processes arrive at time 0.
Process | Burst Time
P1 | 6
P2 | 8
P3 | 7
P4 | 3
A company buys a machine for Rs. 200,000. It has a useful life of 5 years and a salvage value of Rs. 20,000. What is the annual depreciation using the straight-line method?
Which of the following SQL queries will find the names of all employees whose name starts with the letter 'A'?

choices.text: SELECT name FROM employees WHERE name = 'A%';
SELECT name FROM employees WHERE name LIKE 'A%';
SELECT name FROM employees WHERE name STARTS WITH 'A';
SELECT name FROM employees WHERE name = 'A*';

questions.text: What is the key difference between method overloading and method overriding?

choices.text: Overloading occurs in the same class; overriding occurs in a subclass.
Overloading involves changing the return type; overriding does not.
Overloading is resolved at runtime; overriding is resolved at compile time.
There is no difference.

questions.text: How many address lines are required to address a memory of 32 KB? (Assume a byte-addressable memory, 1 KB = 1024 bytes).
A digital communication channel has a bandwidth of 3000 Hz and a signal-to-noise ratio of 1023. What is the maximum channel capacity according to the Shannon-Hartley theorem?

choices.text: All strings ending in 1.
All strings containing at least one 1.
All strings with an even number of 1s.
All strings starting with 0.

questions.text: In the context of AI, what is the main drawback of the 'Greedy Best-First Search' algorithm?

choices.text: It is very slow.
It is not guaranteed to find the optimal path.
It requires a huge amount of memory.
It can only be used for tree-based searches.

questions.text: Consider a system using the LRU (Least Recently Used) page replacement algorithm with 3 frames. What is the number of page faults for the reference string: 7, 0, 1, 2, 0, 3, 0, 4, 2, 3, 0, 3, 2?
What is the primary motivation for using a component-based software engineering approach?

choices.text: To write code from scratch for every new project.
To build software by assembling reusable, pre-built components.
To focus exclusively on procedural programming.
To eliminate the need for software testing.
Integer version
Double version
Compilation Error due to ambiguity
No output

questions.text: A combinational circuit is defined by the Boolean function F(X,Y,Z) = Σ(1, 3, 5, 7). This function can be simplified to:

choices.text: F = X
F = Y
F = Z
F = X + Y + Z

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the role of a project manager?

choices.text: To write all the critical code for the project.
To be responsible for the planning, execution, and closing of a project.
To test the final product before delivery.
To provide the financial resources for the project.
